references:
For the CODEBOOK construction, we train a set of model for scenarios with {2,3,4}234\{2,3,4\} MAPs. This approach may be assimilated to the standard state-of-the-art approach with specialized models that do not take into account a variable number of MAP.
For the exploitation phase, when Ms​(t)>4subscript𝑀𝑠𝑡4M_{s}(t)>4, a random model is sampled from the Ms​(t)=4subscript𝑀𝑠𝑡4M_{s}(t)=4 codebook. For the C-MADRL and the F-MADRL training, we randomly deploy from 222 to 555 MAPs on a random locations sampled in a 200​m200m200~{}\mathrm{m} by 200​m200m200~{}\mathrm{m} area, where K​(t)=25𝐾𝑡25K(t)=25 UEs are deployed. Table II summarizes simulation parameters.
